body: I don't think we should warn about that example.  The C code here is not following the rules, but there is nothing we can do to prevent that.  The rules are clear: when passing the address of an element in an element in an array, the Go memory being passed is the array (the entire array, and nothing but the array).  If the C code chooses to go beyond those bounds, it is broken, though the breakage is undetectable.
